preqs: LAW5004 (for students beginning in 2015 or later) and LAW7265 or LAW5002

rules.ruleString: For COURSE_CODE NOT IN {3387} Do Any co-req (I/W) unit in {LAW5004} Otherwise true
Must have passed 2 (I/W) units in {LAW5000, LAW5002, LAW5080}
Must be enrolled in course version {3387, L6005}

description: The unit examines the concept and categories of real and personal property; the interface between contractual and property rights; the nature of types of property right including freehold and leasehold estates, modes of creating and transferring property rights in law and equity; possession as a source of title, and includes types of property rights in land owned by another, such as mortgages, easements, restrictive covenants and profits a prendre.
